item.title: Antonella add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "It’s a very American illness, the idea of giving yourself away entirely to the idea of working in order to achieve some sort of brass ring that usually involves people feeling some way about you – I mean, people wonder why we walk around feeling alienated and lonely and stressed out." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Antonella add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "There's a fine line between thinking about somebody and thinking about not thinking about somebody, but I have the patience and the self-control to walk that line for hours - days, if I have to." -- Jennifer Egan

item.title: Antonella add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Angry, and half in love with her, and tremendously sorry, I turned away." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald
